page.title: 03FARMING:HINTON CHARTERHOUSE
page.content: MOST OF THE{FARMLAND}AROUND HINTON CHARTERHOUSE (CONSISTING OF THE OLD LAND OF HINTON FARM, HINTONFIELD FARM & HINTON_NORWOOD FARM) IS NOW OWNED BY ONE COMPANY. THERE ARE 800 ACRES, OF WHICH 170 ACRES ARE FORESTRY, AND THE REST IS CORN & GRASS. THE MAIN FARMYARD IS IN THE VILLAGE, AND CONTAINS THE MAIN BARN. THIS HAS TWELVE THOUSAND SQUARE FEET OF STORAGE SPACE. THERE ARE ALSO ELEVEN SMALLER BARNS, AND BETWEEN ALL TWELVE, THERE ARE TWENTY-THREE THOUSAND SQUARE FEET OF STORAGE SPACE. THE EQUIPMENT INCLUDES 3 TRACTORS, 2 PLOUGHS, AND A COMBINE BUT THERE ARE ONLY TWO FARMWORKERS. THE THIRTY FIELDS ARE DIVIDED BY BOTH FENCES & HEDGES. THE OLD FARMHOUSES ARE NOW PRIVATELY OWNED, AND ARE NOT USED FOR FARMING PURPOSES TODAY.
